newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo mulls joining Azerbaijan oil deal.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo mulls joining Azerbaijan oil deal.

text.p: South Korea's Daewoo Group is considering buying a stake in an oil venture in Azerbaijan, a Daewoo official said on Monday.
"We are considering participating in an oil business in Azerbaijan," a Daewoo official said but declined to give further details.

A local news report in Moscow said Daewoo Group joined a $2 billion oil deal to tap offshore reserves in Azerbaijan but the Daewoo official said: "We have not signed any agreement or letter of intent for an oil venture there."
The official said that Azerbaijan was one of former Eastern bloc countries where Daewoo seeks investment in automobile, electronics, financial and communications areas.
